intro: Brossaea acuminata, commonly known as the acuminated brossaea, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring. Brossaea acuminata thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
